question: The main difference between the EU and the US approaches to the legal regime of personal data is
options: that the EU treats personal data as as an aspect of individual personality, whereas the US treats data as a market
that only the US protect privacy
that only the US approach leverages individual consent to protect privacy

question: Correcting illegal bias in AI
options: must be done in a way that does not violate basic legal principles such as equality
can be done only by amending the algorithm or the dataset for the training

question: The processing of personal data pursuant to the GDPR may be lawfully carried out
options: When data subjects expressed their own consent
Based on the controller’s free choice
When there is no consent by data subjects, but the processing is needed for protecting the data subjects’ or other individuals’ vital interests
When there is no consent, but the processing must take place to perform a contract between the controller and any third party

question: Which of the following are legislative instruments belonging to EU primary law?
options: Treaty of the European Union, Treaty on the functioning of the European Union, Case-law of the European Court of Justice
Treaty of the European Union, Treaty on the functioning of the European Union, Charter of fundamental rights of the European Union
Charter of fundamental rights of the European Union, Regulations, Case-law of the European Court of Justice

question: Which of the following answers is correct? The hierarchical system of EU law is structured as such:
options: (1) Primary Law, (2) Secondary Law, (3) International Agreements
(1) Founding treaties, (2) International Agreements, (3) Secondary Law
(1) Primary Law, (3) Secondary Law, (3) Member States law
